title: Aspen pays $20m for 84 Perth homes
text:
ASX-listed accommodation provider Aspen Group has bought 84 existing build-to-rent properties in Perth for $20 million as it pursues a younger demographic and shifts towards a long-term leasing model.

Aspen buys 84 existing homes in Rockingham, Perth for $20 million.

The deal equates to approximately $238,000 per dwelling and $1,258 per square metre of dwelling area.

The purchase price was at least 20 per cent below the average selling price of Perth houses and 33 per cent lower than replacement cost.

The properties which have been rented for $351 per week on average are set to achieve a 7.7 per cent gross yield at full occupancy.

Located in the local area of Rockingham, 48 kilometres southwest of the Perth CBD, the homes have an average landsize of 414 square metres and come with 3 to 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and double car garages.
description: ASX-listed accommodation provider Aspen has bought 84 existing build-to-rent properties in Perth for $20 million as it shifts towards a long-term leasing model.
